sentence: J. C. Penney Company, Inc. 's JCP CEO designee Marvin Ellison is making every possible effort to ensure that the retailer's turnaround strategies pay off.

At the Piper Jaffray conference held yesterday, Ellison, a former executive of The Home Depot, Inc. HD , stated that the company has massive upside potential as its slump was not due poor economic backdrop or tough competition but simply a set of strategic initiatives that did not work out.
Ellison, who will take over current CEO Mike Ullman in August, has been sharing responsibilities with the latter since last October, when Ellison was announced the next CEO.
To lift the company's performance, Ellison stated that he has been focusing on improving the high margin center core at its stores that houses Sephora, handbag, shoes and fashion jewelry departments.
The company is also overhauling its shoe department to bring in more female customers.
Further, developing omni-channel capacities remains a top priority for the company.
The company is looking to integrate all its stores with its website.
It also plans to launch buy online ship-to-store, buy online return-to-store, buy online shipped from store and buy online pickup same-day services in all stores within 2016.
Most of the capital expenditure would be directed toward setting up huge distribution centers at strategic locations to speed up deliveries.
The company also plans to revamp the home category.
Ellison also reiterated the guidance of achieving the targeted $1.2 billion EBITDA by 2017.
J. C. Penney has been in troubled waters ever since then CEO Ron Johnson's ambitious transformation plans misfired and left the company tattered.
Johnson was ousted and current CEO Ullman was reinstated to bring back the company on the growth trajectory.
Though Ellison appears confident of turning around J. C. Penney's fortune, we believe the whole process is going to be a time consuming affair.
At present, J. C. Penney holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
Other favorably ranked stocks in the retail sector include Gordmans Stores, Inc. GMAN and American Eagle Outfitters, Inc. AEO .
Both the stocks sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).
